log.user: I see your point about the high deductibles and co-pays under Obamacare being an issue, but I don't necessarily agree that it means the program as a whole is not working. While it's true that some people are facing high out-of-pocket costs, it's important to remember that Obamacare has also expanded access to health insurance for millions of Americans who previously didn't have coverage. Additionally, the program has helped to lower the uninsured rate and has put into place certain provisions to protect consumers and ensure they receive quality care. So while there are certainly some challenges with Obamacare, I believe it is generally making progress towards achieving its goal of making healthcare more accessible and affordable for all Americans.

It's important to consider the broader context and the overall impact that Obamacare has had on the healthcare system, such as expanding access to preventive care services and eliminating pre-existing condition exclusions.
